Title: AI Job Interview Platform

The process starts from the candidate signing up to the platform then upload his resume. Then, the candidate post the link for the job post from LinkedIn or similar websites, or basically post the job description in a specific box, where the AI generated questions are derived from. Also, there must be a field for the job title where the candidate is filed. In case the candidate does not provide the job description, the AI Agent will create one from the job title the candidate provided. After that the interview starts. The interview must be via Zoom which is similar to the real one. Camera must be opened and the AI Agent who interview the candidate must be with very realistic Avatar (HeyGen). The interview must be ultra realistic and very close to the real job interviews. Latency must be low with the latest tech on recognizing speeches and transferring them. Eye Movement & Face Tracking tool must be integrated to check if the candidate is reading from another docs or devices during the interview to make the interview as authentic as possible. After the interview is done, the candidate should have the option to publish to recruiters portal (built in the same website and similar to LinkedIn but simpler) so recruiter can search and filter the candidates who successfully completed the interviews and published the results to the portal. Notes: - Fgima Design is ready. The selected developer must start immediately. - The developer must have prior AI projects experience, and provide the least amount with the time to finish is probably taking the project. Description: Job Description: Senior AI Engineer (Pilot Project — NLP + Computer Vision) Position: Senior AI Engineer (Contract/Pilot Project) Location: Remote (Canada-based preferred, but open) Type: 3-month contract, with potential for extension or permanent role Start Date: As soon as available About Easewell Easewell is an innovative health tech startup redefining access to pain relief through AI-driven, affordable, and scalable solutions. Our vision is to empower people worldwide with the tools and coaching they need to overcome chronic pain instantly, and from anywhere. We’re now building the next evolution of our platform: AI-powered real-time exercise coaching that combines GPT-style conversational feedback with computer vision to see, analyze, and guide users through exercises during live video sessions. We are a mission-driven team seeking an experienced engineer to help us bring this proof-of-concept (POC) to life. The Opportunity We are looking for a Senior AI/ Engineer with expertise in both NLP (LLMs) and real-time computer vision to design and build a working prototype of our AI coaching system. This is a short-term contract designed as a paid pilot project. It’s perfect for someone who enjoys building bleeding-edge MVPs, thrives in a fast-moving startup environment, and cares about making a difference in people’s lives. Responsibilities • Design and implement a POC that integrates: • GPT-style conversational AI (OpenAI or open-source alternatives). • Real-time pose detection (OpenPose, Mediapipe, MoveNet, or similar). • Simple backend to deliver feedback to users in a live video session. • Recommend and set up the tech stack for scalability. • Collaborate with our founder, program manager, and tech assistant to iterate quickly on requirements. • Document your work and explain tradeoffs clearly to a non-technical audience. • Optionally advise on longer-term architecture for future development. ✅ About You • You have 5+ years of experience building AI/ systems, with proven work on both NLP and computer vision. • You’ve worked with GPT-3/4 or open-source LLMs in a production or research setting. • You have built real-time or near-real-time video inference pipelines and are familiar with pose estimation frameworks. • You’re comfortable working independently and explaining technical details clearly to a non-technical founder. • You’re excited by mission-driven startups and fast MVP cycles. • Bonus: experience in health tech, physiotherapy, or telehealth is a plus. Why Join Easewell (Even for a Pilot) • Work on a meaningful product with a global impact. • Get in early on a fast-growing, funded Canadian startup. • Flexible, remote-friendly work. • Potential for long-term or equity-based engagement after pilot success. How to Apply If this resonates with you, please send: • Your resume • A short note explaining your relevant experience and why you’re interested. • Links to any past projects, publications, or demos (if available). • Your availability and rate for a 3-month contract. We know your time is valuable and we’ll review all applications carefully and respond promptly.

Title: Python and LLM script to scrape data from job postings
Tags: Python, LLM Prompt Engineering
Payment Info:
Est. budget:
$200.00
Description: BACKGROUND I need to extract contact information of companies who post job openings on Dice.com, an IT job portal. I am looking for a Python script, potentially using AI and Prompt Engineering to extract the email address and phone number of a company given its web address. The script ultimately stores the following information in a CSV file: 1. URL of Dice.com job posting 2. Title of job posting 3. Name of company 4. URL of company 5. Email of company 6. Phone number of company 7. Timestamp of extraction date EXECUTION STEPS 1. Open Google, search for this exact phrase (including quotes): "Accepts corp to corp applications" "remote" azure site:dice.com 2. Under Tools, click on Any Time, click on Past month. 3. For each search result: a. Open the search results one by one, which takes you the job posting on Dice. b. Click on the company name, which takes you to the company page on Dice. c. Click on View Website, which takes you to the company website. d. Search the website for a contact email address and/ or phone number. Places to look for are the Contact Us page, and the footer. e. Write down in the CSV file the fields requested above. ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA Being a software engineer myself, I will rely on the following AC for Definition of Done. That is, I will test the script by the following criteria: 1. All steps listed under EXECUTION STEPS are implemented 2. The CSV file contains all the fields listed above 3. Considering the probabilistic nature of LLM, more than 80% of the phone number and email address fields are filled out in the CSV file 4. The script scrapes the email address and phone number of websites which are found in the homepage (for example, techaffinity.com) 5. The script scrapes the email address and phone number of websites which are *not* found in the homepage (for example, saxonglobal.com) THANK YOU If you feel that you can accomplish the same outcome through other means, please do let me know. Thank you for looking.

Title: Experiment Robot Manipulation with AI
Tags: PyTorch, Neural Network
Payment Info:
Est. budget:
$40.00
Description: Bring up Existing Code to Fine-Tune NVIDIA GROOT 1.5N for So-Arm 100 on AWS EC2 Description We’re looking for a skilled freelancer to replicate NVIDIA’s GROoT N1.5 tuning workflow for the So-Arm 100 robotic arm and SO-Arm 101 , following this guide: https://huggingface.co/blog/nvidia/gr00t-n1-5-so101-tuning and using the example code here: https://github.com/NVIDIA/Isaac-GR00T/tree/main/getting_started/examples What You’ll Do Spin up and configure an AWS EC2 GPU instance (e.g. p3/p4). Install CUDA, cuDNN, Python packages, and any other dependencies. Clone and adapt the getting_started/examples from NVIDIA’s GitHub. Wire in provided So-Arm 100 assets (URDF, demo ). Run the fine-tuning steps: prep, training loop, checkpointing, evaluation. Tweak key settings ( rate, batch size) for best robotic performance. Validate with simple reach/control tests. Deliver all code, scripts, model checkpoints, and a quick “how-to” README. Ideal Background Comfortable with Python and command-line Linux. Experience installing deep- frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow) on GPU servers. Familiarity with Hugging Face tutorials or similar “model fine-tuning” examples. Basic understanding of robotics concepts (URDF, kinematics) a plus—but not mandatory. Deliverables Modified training scripts and config files. Fine-tuned GROoT 1.5N model checkpoints. Simple demo script showing So-Arm 100 motion control. README with setup & run instructions.
